1120324886461706240.text: Save the date! One week from today, join @NASAedu for this #NASASTEM event! This is a great opportunity for college and high school students to join the discussion with @JimBridenstine about how we're going forward to the Moon...to stay. #NASAinternshttps://twitter.com/NASAedu/status/1118944509159776257 …

1122923619678552064.text: LIVE NOW: The Future of Space broadcast with our leadership and college students from around the country! Tune in to see if your #AskNASA questions are answered. Learn about our careers & find your place in space:https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1OdKrvdapelKX …

1120864929697927168.text: The votes are in! Our social media and websites are being honored by the 2019 @TheWebbyAwards.  Find out which sites received this honor and were voted as the People's Voice: https://go.nasa.gov/2GtXRYE . Thank you for your votes and continued engagement!pic.twitter.com/UPvTg13qWn

1119324344684040193.text: Mark your calendars for April 24th 2pm ET for our next Twitter Chat on 'Designing STEM Programs for Girls at Cultural Organizations' with guest tweeters from @IntrepidMuseum & @nysci - Join the conversation #STEMEffect @ngcproject @AAMers @childmuseums @zoos_aquariumspic.twitter.com/BibDwsqatS

1121745774310825986.text:
It's #FridayFact time! Do you know what phase the Moon is in right now? It's a Third Quarter. If you spot the Moon tonight or tomorrow morning, it will look like this --> 

Want to keep track of Moon phases? Make a Moon Phases Calendar! https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/edu/learn/project/make-a-moon-phases-calendar-and-calculator/ …pic.twitter.com/KAlu9qlX3o

1122900856028979203.text: TODAY at 2:25pm ET: High school & college students will ask @AstroHague & @Astro_Christina questions about working & living on the @space_station. This downlink is part of the “Future of Space” #NASASTEM event. Watch live on NASA TV! http://www.nasa.gov/nasatv pic.twitter.com/58FKSCHkAN

1121817915978809344.text: We’re challenging middle & high school students to design protective headwear for @NASA_Astronauts!  Attend the info-session on 4/29 at 6 p.m. EDT to learn more about the #NASA_WEAR challenge! http://go.nasa.gov/NASA_WEAR pic.twitter.com/cC3Xde84Fq

1120794475394154498.text: Just 1 week left to enter the "Artists Inspire Astronauts" contest! Your original artwork could be displayed in the hallways where future crews will stay before launch. Artwork from U.S. citizens ages 18 & older must be submitted by noon EDT on April 30.  https://challenge.gov/a/buzz/challenge/998/ideas/top …pic.twitter.com/MoePKHf0y9

1121498664147484674.text: Educators! Get students excited about @NASA's #Moon2Mars plans with @GoTynker's #ForwardToTheMoon Design-A-Mission-Patch coding challenge! Bring tech ed into your grade 1-8 classroom & win a chance to video chat with a NASA expert. Entries due May 5!  https://gotyn.kr/ForwardToTheMoon …pic.twitter.com/6KnNRmtFtu

1120392088909230081.text: Does our beautiful planet inspire your artistic side?  Celebrate #EarthDay by getting crafty & making a "Stained Glass Earth" to hang in your window. @NASAspaceplace has all the step-by-step details at https://spaceplace.nasa.gov/stained-glass-earth/en/ ….pic.twitter.com/dqihNd3gCv

1121869073980297216.text: Get your space  questions answered by astronauts aboard the @Space_Station & NASA leadership at the "Future of Space" Event this Monday at 2pm EDT! Use #askNASA to have your questions considered! Tune in LIVE here https://www.facebook.com/events/2182397568742389 …pic.twitter.com/MR8roXwuj4

1123006961962762240.text: Are you a student interested in a STEM career? @Astro_Christina encourages you to get involved with extracurriculars focused in your area of STEM interest. Group work is really important, so get outside your comfort zone if you have to! #NASASTEMpic.twitter.com/ZJakgSDlT6

1120719006107828231.text: Tonight's @NASAEPDC webinar is all about @NASAJPL Earth science missions & will explore lessons and resources to promote scientific inquiry in the classroom. Teachers of grades 4-12 -- mark your calendar as busy from 5-6pm EDT & sign up to attend! https://www.eiseverywhere.com/419910 pic.twitter.com/bOuNk9PMQa

1123007319577522177.text: Watch @AstroHague demonstrate the one variable the space station laboratory has that science labs on Earth can’t offer—microgravity! #NASASTEMpic.twitter.com/PqvWedbLNU

1121020971400466432.text:
On this date 29 years ago, the Hubble Space Telescope launched into space. (How old were you when Hubble launched in 1990?)

Celebrate the anniversary with these "What Is Hubble?" articles for K-8 students! 
K-4: https://www.nasa.gov/audience/forstudents/k-4/stories/nasa-knows/what-is-the-hubble-space-telecope-k4.html … 
5-8: https://www.nasa.gov/audience/forstudents/5-8/features/nasa-knows/what-is-the-hubble-space-telecope-58.html …pic.twitter.com/NmosXmMPoo

1121383357596745730.text: Have you heard of "Mission: Geography"? This -based curriculum integrates STEM, geography & language arts with observations, remote sensing & maps to investigate our planet. Join @NASAEPDC at 6pm EDT TONIGHT for a free webinar to learn more. Register at https://www.eiseverywhere.com/418793 .pic.twitter.com/T4pJhq8y2r

1122837261362577408.text:
Today’s the day! The “Future of Space” starts at 2pm EDT, watch the LIVE stream here https://www.facebook.com/events/2182397568742389 …! 

Whether you’re watching from home, with friends or are one of the lucky students in our live audience, we want to hear from YOU! Ask your questions with #askNASA.pic.twitter.com/PoFCxwheGh

1123227243633889280.text:
Wonder how tiny algae help reduce atmospheric CO2 while fueling the marine food web? Interested in ideas that make a topic like ocean color feel more personal? 

Join @NASAOcean today at 2pm EDT for the 1st of 2 free webinars to answer these Qs & more. https://pace.oceansciences.org/events_more.htm?id=39 …pic.twitter.com/gWEIAzkIue

1121141764071534592.text: Tonight at 7:30pm EDT, planetary scientist Brett Denevi will share insights on what recent observations have taught us about the Moon’s ancient history & how its surface continues to change today. Attend the lecture at @airandspace or watch the webcast at https://airandspace.si.edu/events/new-moon pic.twitter.com/cvvNLgYcRO

1123007091730370560.text: How do @NASA_Astronauts keep their mental health in check while living in space? One way is by looking out the cupola! @AstroHague explains how viewing Earth through the @space_station window helps him stay connected to the ground. #NASASTEMpic.twitter.com/8Mx14NOpeM
